newsitem.title: CHINA: China foreign exchange trading volume up in May.
newsitem.headline: China foreign exchange trading volume up in May.

text.p: Trading volume on the Chinese foreign exchange interbank market based in Shanghai, was equivalent to $5.864 billion in May, an increase of 22 percent from April, the Securities Times said on Thursday.
The yuan strengthened against the U.S. dollar, rising to 8.2921 on May 30, from 8.2945 at the end of April, the Shenzhen-based newspaper said.
The Japanese yen, however, reversed early weakness against the Chinese yuan on the Shanghai market thanks to a good performance against the U.S. dollar on the world market, it said.
The Chinese yuan closed at 7.1182 against 100 Japanese yen on May 30, down seven percent compared with the end of April, the newspaper said.
The Chinese yuan remained flat against the Hong Kong dollar in May to end the month at 1.0708, it said.
